resources.string: Section Two: Screening for COVID-19 infection
Right now, do you have any of these symptoms?
Have you been in contact with somebody with symptoms of COVID-19?
Have you been exposed to any health facility where COVID-19 has been reported?
Which of these countries with COVID-19 have you visited in the last 14 days?
In the last 14 days, have you been around anyone with any of these symptoms?
Do you have any of these medical conditions that might put you at risk of severe forms of COVID-19 or for which you have to seek care at health facilities regularly?
Are you on antiretroviral therapy (drugs for treating HIV)?
Do you have enough drugs to last up to 3 months?
Is there someone in your life who is helping you with managing your HIV care right now?
In case you start having severe COVID-19 symptoms, is there someone in your household who could help you get care?
Thank you for taking this self-screening test!
Based on your responses, you may have a high risk of having COVID infection
Therefore, a support staff from the clinic will reach out to you within 6 hours by telephone and provide you with the support you need.
You may need to get tested, be isolated and treated for serious respiratory illness.
